Iraq. In an exclusive interview with ABC News, Donald Rumsfeld concedes that "it's possible" that decisions on how many troops to send into Iraq marked the biggest mistake of the war. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC News. Pressed on the fact that President Bush has written that cutting troop levels in Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war," Donald Rumsfeld called that "interesting

He was reluctant to endorse President Bush 's assessment that the decision to draw down US troops shortly after the 2003 invasion of Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war." I don't have enough confidence to say that that's right. I think that it's possible, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC News anchor Diane Sawyer . "We had[ an] enormous number of troops ready to go in. They had- we had off-ramps, if they weren't needed." "It
